com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Logger

  • public class Logger
extends Object
    Class for logging messages to:
    • Director log if invoked at runtime
    • Connector Access Service log if invoked at design-time.
    The following example shows how to write log messages corresponding to fatal error. 

        Logger.fatal("fatal error !!");

    Version:
    1.0

      • fatal

        public static void fatal(String message)
        Logs messages corresponding to fatal errors. In case of run-time, the job will be aborted by invoking this method.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to log.
        See Also:
        warning(java.lang.String), information(java.lang.String), debug(java.lang.String)

      • debug

        public static void debug(String message)
        Logs debug messages. This log level is disabled and ignored as default. If user set JAVASTAGE_API_DEBUG environment variable with a value "1", this type of messages will be logged.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to log.
        See Also:
        fatal(java.lang.String), warning(java.lang.String), debug(java.lang.String), isDebugEnabled()

      • getComponentID

        public static String getComponentID()
        Retrieves the component ID set by calling setComponentID(String). COMPONENT_ID_DEFAULT defines the default component ID.
        Returns:
        The component ID.
        See Also:
        COMPONENT_ID_DEFAULT

      • setComponentID

        public static void setComponentID(String compID)
        Sets a component ID to use as a part of the message ID that are logged at run time. COMPONENT_ID_DEFAULT property defines the default component ID. The specified component ID is used when a message is logged by calling debug(int, String), information(int, String), warning(int, String), or ConnectorException.ConnectorException(Integer, String).
        Parameters:
        compID - The alphanumeric component ID to use as a part of the component ID. The component ID must be in uppercase although you can use lower case letters. The component ID is truncated if it is longer than the value that is specified by the COMPONENT_ID_MAX_LENproperty. If the component ID is set to COMPONENT_ID_DEFAULT, then the message ID defined in the Java Integration stage is used even if a message number is specified.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the prefix is null, empty, or contains a character that is not alphanumeric.
        See Also:
        COMPONENT_ID_DEFAULT, COMPONENT_ID_MAX_LEN

      • warning

        public static void warning(int messageNumber,
           String message)
        Logs messages with a given message number corresponding to non-fatal errors. It works as warning(String) unless any component ID besides COMPONENT_ID_DEFAULT is set by calling setComponentID(String) explicitly. Also, it works as warning(String) if a given messageNumber is negative or greater than MAX_CUSTOM_MESSAGE_NUMBER.
        Parameters:
        messageNumber - The message number to log.
        message - The message to log.
        See Also:
        information(int, String), debug(int, String), setComponentID(String), COMPONENT_ID_MAX_LEN, MAX_CUSTOM_MESSAGE_NUMBER, MIN_CUSTOM_MESSAGE_NUMBER

      • information

        public static void information(int messageNumber,
               String message)
        Logs information messages with a given message number. It works as information(String) unless any component ID besides COMPONENT_ID_DEFAULT is set by calling setComponentID(String) explicitly. Also, it works as information(String) if a given messageNumber is negative or greater than MAX_CUSTOM_MESSAGE_NUMBER.
        Parameters:
        messageNumber - The message number to log.
        message - The message to log.
        See Also:
        warning(int, String), debug(int, String), setComponentID(String), COMPONENT_ID_MAX_LEN, MAX_CUSTOM_MESSAGE_NUMBER, MIN_CUSTOM_MESSAGE_NUMBER

      • debug

        public static void debug(int messageNumber,
         String message)
        Logs debug messages. This log level is disabled and ignored as default. If user set JAVASTAGE_API_DEBUG environment variable with a value "1", this type of messages with a given message number will be logged. It works as debug(String) unless any component ID besides COMPONENT_ID_DEFAULT is set by calling setComponentID(String) explicitly. Also, it works as debug(String) if a given messageNumber is negative or greater than MAX_CUSTOM_MESSAGE_NUMBER.
        Parameters:
        messageNumber - The message number to log.
        message - The message to log.
        See Also:
        warning(int, String), information(int, String), setComponentID(String), COMPONENT_ID_MAX_LEN, MAX_CUSTOM_MESSAGE_NUMBER, MIN_CUSTOM_MESSAGE_NUMBER, isDebugEnabled()

      • isDebugEnabled

        public static boolean isDebugEnabled()
        Indicates whether the debug(String) method and the debug(int, String) method are enabled.
        Returns:
        true, if the debug methods are enabled. false if the debug methods are not enabled.
        See Also:
        debug(String), debug(int, String)
